subject: RE: [junit] How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... I agree with this, but this seems to be very dependent on culture: what do you value more, a rigid design that tries to prevent errors as much as possible,
messageBody:
> Finally: the very fact that you can change the implementation randomly
> is a benefit, not a problem. In particular, unit test code gains from
> being able to provide an arbitrary implementation of an interface that
> it just can't do with a class.

I agree with this, but this seems to be very dependent on culture: what do
you value more, a rigid design that tries to prevent errors as much as
possible, or a flexible design, that is easy to adapt to new requirements.

Cheers, Ilja
